task.title: Specify Polar Distances
task.shortdesc: AutoSnap restricts cursor movement to increments of a polar distance you specified on the Snap and Grid tab of Drafting Settings dialog box. For example, if you specify a length of 6 units, the cursor snaps the length specified to lengths of 0, 6, 12, 18, 24, and so on.

context.p: When you move the cursor, a tooltip displays the nearest PolarSnap increment. Only when polar tracking and snap mode are on, you can restrict point entry to polar distance.

step.cmd: Choose Tools > Drafting Settings from the main menu.
In the Drafting Settings dialog box, on the Snap and Gridtab, select Snap-On.
Under Polar Spacing, enter the polar distance.
Choose the Polar Tracking taband select Polar Tracking On.
Select an angle from the Increment Angle list. You can specifyyour own angles by choosing Additional Angles and then New.
